sen.j: 硬六派（こうろっぱ）とは、1890年代に対外強硬論を唱えていた対外硬路線を掲げる国家主義・国粋主義的な6党派の連合のこと。
sen.e: The "Ko Roppa" is a pro-nationalism federation of six political parties that advocated a strong foreign policy in 1890s.
The Ko Roppa (the hard-line six parties) was a pro-nationalistic federation of six political parties that advocated a strong foreign policy in 1890s.
The Ko Roppa (the hard-line six parties) was a pro-nationalistic federation of six political parties that advocated a strong foreign policy in 1890s.

sen.j: 「対外硬六派」を略したものである。
sen.e: "Ko Roppa" is an abbreviation of "Taigai Ko Roppa" (six-party hard-liners against foreign countries).
Ko Roppa was an abbreviation of "Taigai Ko Roppa" (six hard-line foreign policies factions).
Ko Roppa was an abbreviation of "Taigai Ko Roppa" (six hard-line foreign policies factions).

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 国粋主義者たちは、明治政府が推進する漸進的な条約改正路線を批判していた。
sen.e: Nationalists were critical of the idea of the Meiji Government promoting step-by-step revisions to the treaties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。セルの背景色が青色から白色に変わってしまいました。
sen.e: Nationalists were critical of the idea of the Meiji Government promoting step-by-step revisions to the treaties.
Nationalists were critical of the idea of the Meiji Government promoting step-by-step revisions to the treaties.

sen.j: 彼らは内地雑居への反対運動を通じて次第に連携を強め、1893年に安部井磐根・佐々友房・神鞭知常らによって大日本協会を結成した。
sen.e: As they led the opposition movement against the government's policy of allowing non-Japanese to live anywhere in Japan, they developed a strong partnership and, in 1893, Iwane ABEI, Tomofusa SASSA, Tomotsune KOMUCHI and some other activists formed the Dai Nihon Kyokai (Great Japan Association).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。
sen.e: They developed a strong partnership as they led the opposition movement against the government's policy of allowing non-Japanese to live anywhere in Japan, and Iwane ABEI, Tomofusa SASSA, Tomotsune KOMUCHI and some other activists formed the Dai Nihon Kyokai (Great Japan Association) in 1893.

They developed a strong partnership as they led the opposition movement against the government's policy of allowing non-Japanese to live anywhere in Japan, and Iwane ABEI, Tomofusa SASSA, Tomotsune KOMUCHI and some other activists formed the Dai Nihon Kyokai (Great Japan Association) in 1893.

sen.j: 彼らは欧米列強が直ちに不平等条約を破棄しなとしたいならば、日本も安政条約の原則通りに外国人に対して外国人居留地以外の居住を認めず貿易を統制するとした。
sen.e: They insisted that the allied western powers abolish the unequal treaties immediately, otherwise Japan would abide by the basic principles, stated in the Ansei Treaties, to prohibit foreign residents from living outside foreign settlements and to restrict trading activities.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。
sen.e: They insisted that the allied western powers abolish the unequal treaties immediately, otherwise Japan would abide by the basic principles, stated in the Ansei Treaties, to prohibit foreign residents from living outside foreign settlements and to restrict trading activities.

They insisted that the allied western powers abolish the unequal treaties immediately, otherwise Japan would abide by the basic principles, stated in the Ansei Treaties, to prohibit foreign residents from living outside foreign settlements and to restrict trading activities.

sen.j: そして、平等条約の締結か外交関係の断絶のいずれかを迫るべきであるとした「条約励行」を唱えた。
sen.e: They advocated that Japan should urge the western powers that either those countries accept new equal treaties or Japan would break off diplomatic relations, believing that fair treaties should be put into effect.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。元の和文では主語「日本」が省かれていますが、訳文には入れています。
sen.e: They advocated that Japan should urge the western powers that either those countries accept new equal treaties or Japan would break off diplomatic relations.
sen.cmt: 原文には書かれていない事も翻訳されていました。
sen.e: They advocated that Japan should urge the western powers that either those countries accept new equal treaties or Japan would break off diplomatic relations.

sen.j: 大日本協会は超党派の団体であり、佐々のように国民協会_(日本)に所属したまま、大日本協会に属している代議士や大日本協会専属の議員など、所属形態は多様であった。
sen.e: The Dai Nihon Kyokai was a nonpartisan organization consisted of members from different political parties, including representatives, like Sassa, who also belonged to the Kokumin Kyokai (National Association), and some councilors who belonged exclusively to the Dai Nihon Kyokai.

The Dai Nihon Kyokai was a nonpartisan organization consisting of members from different political parties, including representatives such as Sassa, who also belonged to the Kokumin Kyokai (National Association), and some councilors belonging exclusively to the Dai Nihon Kyokai.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: The Dai Nihon Kyokai was a nonpartisan organization consisting of members from different political parties, including representatives such as Sassa, who also belonged to the Kokumin Kyokai (National Association), and some councilors belonging exclusively to the Dai Nihon Kyokai.

sen.j: 大日本協会の動きに対して東洋自由党・同盟倶楽部・立憲改進党・国民協会・政務調査会_(明治時代の政党)の5党派がこれに呼応して、「日英通商航海条約締結の反対」・「清国への早期開戦」を掲げて共闘を約した。
sen.e: In response to the Dai Nihon Kyokai's campaign, five parties in Meiji period -- the Toyo Jiyuto (Oriental Liberal Party), the Domei Club (Alliance Club), the Rikken Kaishinto (Constitutional Progressive Party), the Kokumin Kyokai, and the Policy Affairs Research Council -- promised to bond together to fight, chanting slogans such as "Down with the conclusion of the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation" and "Waging a war against Qing at an early stage."

The Toyo Jiyuto (Oriental Liberal Party), the Domei Club (Alliance Club), the Rikken Kaishinto (Constitutional Progressive Party), the Kokumin Kyokai, and the Policy Affairs Research Council of the five parties of the Meiji period, promised to bond together to fight in response to the Dai Nihon Kyokai's campaign, chanting slogans such as "protesting the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation" and "wage a early war against Qing."

The Toyo Jiyuto (Oriental Liberal Party), the Domei Club (Alliance Club), the Rikken Kaishinto (Constitutional Progressive Party), the Kokumin Kyokai, and the Policy Affairs Research Council of the five parties of the Meiji period, promised to bond together to fight in response to the Dai Nihon Kyokai's campaign, chanting slogans such as "protesting the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation" and "wage a early war against Qing."

sen.j: この5党派と大日本協会専属議員を1会派と看做した併せて6つの党派を対外硬六派、略して硬六派と呼んだのである。
sen.e: These five parties and a group of councilors who belonged exclusively to the Dai Nihon Kyokai were regarded as the "Taigai Ko Roppa" (six-party hardliners against foreign countries), or the "Ko Roppa" for short.

These five parties and a group of councilors who belonged exclusively to the Dai Nihon Kyokai were regarded as the "Taigai Ko Roppa" (six hard-line foreign policies faction) or the "Ko Roppa" for short.

These five parties and a group of councilors who belonged exclusively to the Dai Nihon Kyokai were regarded as the "Taigai Ko Roppa" (six hard-line foreign policies faction) or the "Ko Roppa" for short.

sen.j: 帝国議会設置以来、衆議院では、自由党_(明治)・立憲改進党に代表される自由民権運動を継承する民党とこれに反対する国民協会に代表される温和派（吏党）が対立を続けてきた。
sen.e: After the constitution of the Imperial Diet, there had been conflicts between the "Minto" (People's Party) and the "Rito" (Bureaucrats' Party); the former, represented with the Jiyuto (Liberal Party) (in Meiji period) and the Rikken Kaishinto, supported the Freedom and People's Rights Movement, and the latter, moderates represented with the Kokumin Kyokai, opposed it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。
sen.e: There were conflicts between the "Minto" (People's Party) representing the Jiyuto (Liberal Party) in Meiji period and the Rikken Kaishinto supporting the Freedom and People's Rights Movement, and the "Rito" (Bureaucrats' Party) representing the Kokumin Kyokai after the constitution of the Imperial Diet opposed it.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: There were conflicts between the "Minto" (People's Party) representing the Jiyuto (Liberal Party) in Meiji period and the Rikken Kaishinto supporting the Freedom and People's Rights Movement, and the "Rito" (Bureaucrats' Party) representing the Kokumin Kyokai after the constitution of the Imperial Diet opposed it.

sen.j: それが、ここにおいて初めて民党と吏党の大連合が成立したのである
sen.e: Therefore, this was the first time a broad-based coalition of liberal and bureaucratic parties was formed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。セルの背景色が青色から白色に変わってしまいました。
sen.e: Therefore, this was the first broad-based coalition of Minto and Rito parties.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: Therefore, this was the first broad-based coalition of Minto and Rito parties.

sen.j: これに対して日英通商航海条約の締結を間近に控えた第2次伊藤内閣は警戒感を強め、また衆議院第1党の自由党も条約改正に関しては政府の漸進主義に賛同していたために反発を強めた。
sen.e: The second Ito cabinet, with the conclusion of the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation near at hand, became wary of the situation, and the Jiyuto, the first party of the House of Representatives, also showed a strong reaction because the party had been supporting the government's idea of step-by-step revisions to the treaty.

The second Ito cabinet became wary of the situation with the signing of the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation near at hand, and the Liberal Party, which was the first party of the House of Representatives, strengthened the opposition from supporting the government's idea of step-by-step revisions to the treaty.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: The second Ito cabinet became wary of the situation with the signing of the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation near at hand, and the Liberal Party, which was the first party of the House of Representatives, strengthened the opposition from supporting the government's idea of step-by-step revisions to the treaty.

sen.j: 地租軽減問題や行政整理では伊藤内閣と自由党も対立関係にあったことから、政局は伊藤内閣・自由党・硬六派による三つ巴の対立構図が形成された。
sen.e: As the Ito cabinet and the Jiyuto had been in disagreement over such issues as land tax cuts and government reforms, there started in politics a three-cornered confrontation among the Ito cabinet, the Jiyuto, and the Ko Roppa.

As the Ito cabinet and the Liberal Party disagreed over land tax cuts and government reform issues, three-cornered confrontation among the Ito cabinet, the Jiyuto, and the Ko Roppa formed within the politics.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: As the Ito cabinet and the Liberal Party disagreed over land tax cuts and government reform issues, three-cornered confrontation among the Ito cabinet, the Jiyuto, and the Ko Roppa formed within the politics.

sen.j: 1893年、第2次伊藤内閣は衆議院解散を行って大日本協会会員が外国人を襲撃したことを理由に解散を命じた。
sen.e: In 1893, the second Ito cabinet dissolved the House of Representatives and ordered the Dai Nihon Kyokai to disband, citing the fact that some members of the association had attacked people from other countries.
The second Ito cabinet dissolved the House of Representatives and ordered the Dai Nihon Kyokai to disband in 1893, citing the fact that some of its members attacked people from other countries.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: The second Ito cabinet dissolved the House of Representatives and ordered the Dai Nihon Kyokai to disband in 1893, citing the fact that some of its members attacked people from other countries.

sen.j: だが、硬六派が第3回衆議院議員総選挙後に内閣不信任上奏案を提出したため、翌1894年に再度解散に踏み切った。
sen.e: However, after the third general election for the House of Representatives, the Ko Roppa tabled a no-confidence motion to be reported to the Emperor, which resulted in the Diet having to dissolve itself in 1894.

However, the Ko Roppa tabled a no-confidence motion to be reported to the Emperor after the third general election for the House of Representatives, which resulted in the Diet having to dissolve itself in 1894.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: However, the Ko Roppa tabled a no-confidence motion to be reported to the Emperor after the third general election for the House of Representatives, which resulted in the Diet having to dissolve itself in 1894.

sen.j: 第4回衆議院議員総選挙最中に日清戦争が始まった。
sen.e: It was in the middle of the fourth general election for the House of Representatives when the Sino-Japanese War broke out.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。セルの背景色が青色から白色に変わってしまいました。
sen.e: It was in the middle of the fourth general election for the House of Representatives when the Sino-Japanese War broke out.
It was in the middle of the fourth general election for the House of Representatives when the Sino-Japanese War broke out.

sen.j: 自由党・硬六派ともに政府との政治休戦を宣言したが、硬六派に対する世論の支持が広がった。
sen.e: Although both the Jiyuto and the Ko Roppa declared a truce with the government, the tide of public opinion shifted toward the Ko Roppa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。
sen.e: Although both the Liberal Party and the Ko Roppa declared a truce with the government, public support for the Ko Roppa increased.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: Although both the Liberal Party and the Ko Roppa declared a truce with the government, public support for the Ko Roppa increased.

sen.j: 同選挙後には無所属議員による大手倶楽部の結成などにより政界再編成が進んだ。
sen.e: After the election, an extensive reshuffle of the government was carried out, including the newly-formed Ote Club, a party by nonpartisans.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。セルの背景色が青色から白色に変わってしまいました。
sen.e: An extensive reorganization of the government was carried out after the election, including the Ote Club established by nonpartisans.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: An extensive reorganization of the government was carried out after the election, including the Ote Club established by nonpartisans.

sen.j: それにより、立憲改進党・国民協会・立憲革新党・中国進歩党・帝国財政革新会・大手倶楽部の6党派による新たな硬六派が形成されることになった。
sen.e: Thus the new Ko Roppa was to be formed by six parties: the Rikken Kaishinto, the Kokumin Kyokai, the Rikken Kakushinto (Constitutional Reform Party), the Chugoku Shinpoto (Western Region of Japan Progressive Party), the Conference of Reform of Imperial Financial Affairs, and the Ote Club.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。
sen.e: Thus, the new Ko Roppa was formed by six parties consisting of the Rikken Kaishinto, the Kokumin Kyokai, the Rikken Kakushinto (Constitutional Reform Party), the Chugoku Shinpoto (Western Region of Japan Progressive Party), the Conference of Reform of Imperial Financial Affairs, and the Ote Club.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: Thus, the new Ko Roppa was formed by six parties consisting of the Rikken Kaishinto, the Kokumin Kyokai, the Rikken Kakushinto (Constitutional Reform Party), the Chugoku Shinpoto (Western Region of Japan Progressive Party), the Conference of Reform of Imperial Financial Affairs, and the Ote Club.

sen.j: 硬六派は日清戦争中は政府に協力的な姿勢を示したが、三国干渉を政府が受け入れた事を非難し、戦後は倒閣への動きを見せ始める。
sen.e: During the Sino-Japanese War, the Ko Roppa had been showing a cooperative attitude toward the government, but after the war ended, the party started to take action to overthrow the government, criticizing it for having accepted the Triple Intervention (a diplomatic intervention by Russia, Germany and France).
sen.cmt: 元の和文には説明がありませんが、訳文には「三国干渉」の説明を括弧内に入れています。
sen.e: The Ko Roppa showed a cooperative attitude toward the government during the Sino-Japanese War, but the party started to take action to overthrow the government after the war while criticizing it for accepting the Triple Intervention (a diplomatic intervention by Russia, Germany and France).
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: The Ko Roppa showed a cooperative attitude toward the government during the Sino-Japanese War, but the party started to take action to overthrow the government after the war while criticizing it for accepting the Triple Intervention (a diplomatic intervention by Russia, Germany and France).

sen.j: ここに至って伊藤内閣と議会内で孤立した自由党が連携を宣言した。
sen.e: At this point, the Ito cabinet and the Jiyuto, which had been isolated in the Diet, announced their cooperation.
The Ito cabinet and the Liberal Party isolated in the Diet, announced their cooperation at this stage.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: The Ito cabinet and the Liberal Party isolated in the Diet, announced their cooperation at this stage.

sen.j: これに対して硬六派側も合同して新党を結成する動きを見せた。
sen.e: In response, the Ko Roppa began to form a new party.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。セルの背景色が青色から白色に変わってしまいました。
sen.e: In response, the Ko Roppa began to form a new party.
In response, the Ko Roppa began to form a new party.

sen.j: 1896年に国民協会を除く5党派は合同して進歩党_(明治)となった。
sen.e: In 1896, five parties of the Ko Roppa, except the Kokumin Kyokai, joined forces to form the Shinpoto (Progressive Party) (in Meiji Period).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。セルの背景色が青色から白色に変わってしまいました。
sen.e: Five parties of the Ko Roppa, except the Kokumin Kyokai, joined forces to form the Shinpoto (Progressive Party) (in Meiji Period) in 1896.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: Five parties of the Ko Roppa, except the Kokumin Kyokai, joined forces to form the Shinpoto (Progressive Party) (in Meiji Period) in 1896.

sen.j: 吏党色の強かった国民協会は自由党・進歩党のどちらにも与しなかった。
sen.e: As the Kokumin Kyokai had been bureaucratically inclined, it didn't take sides with either the Jiyuto or the Shinpoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。セルの背景色が青色から白色に変わってしまいました。
sen.e: As the Kokumin Kyokai was bureaucratically inclined, it did not take sides with either the Liberal Party or the Shinpoto.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: As the Kokumin Kyokai was bureaucratically inclined, it did not take sides with either the Liberal Party or the Shinpoto.

sen.j: 第3党路線を採って「三党鼎立」を目指すが、党勢不振により1899年に解党した。
sen.e: The Kokumin Kyokai sought to realize the "tripartite factions" in the Diet by remaining to be a third party, but as it failed to extend the political power, the association ended up dissolving itself in 1899.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。セルの背景色が青色から白色に変わってしまいました。
sen.e: The Kokumin Kyokai sought to realize the "tripartite factions" in the Diet by remaining to be a third party, but the association ended up dissolving itself in 1899 as it failed to extend the political power.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: The Kokumin Kyokai sought to realize the "tripartite factions" in the Diet by remaining to be a third party, but the association ended up dissolving itself in 1899 as it failed to extend the political power.
